member.name: T:AnalysisBase.AbstractStrongAnalyser
member.summary: Provides sensible defaults for some of the functionality required by IAnalyser2.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.AnalysisCoordinator
member.summary:
Prepares, runs and completes analyses.
*** DO NOT CHANGE THIS CLASS UNLESS INSTRUCTED TOO ***.

remarks.para: The process to analyze files can be complex. The overall idea is to begin with an analysis type and a list of audio objects and segments. Then those files are segmented using default settings from the analysis and possible modifications to the defaults by a user. Each segment is analyzed, and the results are put into either a purpose-created folder (which might be deleted once that analysis is complete), or a known location for later use.
Temp files can also be stored in sub folders named by analysis name and files named by segment id when another analysis is run, the files are overwritten.

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.AnalysisCoordinator.#ctor(AnalysisBase.ISourcePreparer,AnalysisBase.SaveBehavior,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class but also allows for advanced channel mapping options.
member.param: Defines when intermediate WAVE files should be saved.
Whether or not to run the analysis with multiple threads.
Whether or not to create unique directories per segment (in both temp and output directories).

member.summary: Gets SourcePreparer.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisCoordinator.UniqueDirectoryPerSegment
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to create uniquely named sub directories for each run, or reuse a single folder named using the analysis name. Applies to both temp and output directories.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to run in parallel.

member.param: The base output directory (either normal output or a temp directory).
The to extract the identifier from.
An optional list of sub folders to append to the path.
member.returns: A combined directory made up of all the path fragments.

member.summary: Analyze one or more file segments using the same analysis and settings. Note each segment could be sourced from separate original audio files! If using a remote source preparer the segments could even be downloaded from a remote source!.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings
member.summary: The analysis settings for processing one audio file.
member.remarks:
All members in this class are prefixed either with. Segment or. Analysis. Members prefixed with Segment change per segment. Members prefixed with Analysis are invariant for the Analysis.
This class MUST be deeply serializable as it crosses serialization boundaries.
The only files and folders an analysis may access are the audio file, configuration file and any file or folder in the working directory. The working directory may be deleted after the analysis is complete.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.instanceId
member.summary: Used to track instances of this class through parallelism - must be readonly.

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets the instance tracking integer.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisTempDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the temp directory that is the base of the folder structure that analyses can use. The contents of this directory may be deleted after the analysis is finished. If this value is null, AnalysisCoordinator will fallback to AnalysisTempDirectoryFallback. Analysis implementations must not set this.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.IsAnalysisTempDirectoryValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether is not null and exists.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisTempDirectoryFallback
member.summary: Gets a base temp directory. The directory will exist and it will be unique. Anything put here will be deleted when the analysis is complete.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisChannelSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets the ChannelSelection array - a list of channels to extract from the audio.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisMixDownToMono
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to mix all selected channels down into one mono channel.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisOutputDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the output directory that is the base of the folder structure that analyses can use. Analysis implementations must not set this.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisImageSaveBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the AnalysisImageSaveBehavior for images The save behavior defines whether intermediate results generated by the segment should be saved or not.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisDataSaveBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether intermediate data files should be saved. The save behavior defines whether intermediate results generated by the segment should be saved or not.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisMinSegmentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum audio file duration the analysis can process. This is the min duration without including overlap. Overlap will be added. This should be set to an initial value by an analysis. This value is used in TODO: a chunk of audio without the overlap is a 'segment step'.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisMaxSegmentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum audio file duration the analysis can process. This is the max duration without including overlap. Overlap will be added. This means that a segment may be larger than this value. This should be set to an initial value by an analysis.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.SegmentOverlapDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration for segments to overlap. This should be set to an initial value by an analysis.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.SegmentMediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets the media type the analysis expects. This should be set to an initial value by an analysis.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisTargetSampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the audio sample rate the analysis expects (in hertz). This is initially set to the value of the DefaultTargetSampleRateKey setting in the AP.Settings.json. This used to be set by a constant in each implementation of an analysis. A null value indicates that no sample rate modification will be done.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.ConfigFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration file to use to run the analysis.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.ConfigDict
member.summary: Gets or sets the config dictionary.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.Configuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the object of other configuration properties. Should be mutually exclusive with ConfigFile.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalysisSettings.AnalysisAnalyzerSpecificConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets an object that can be used to store arbitrary configuration or options. This is useful for passing information between BeforeAnalyze and Analyze. DO NOT STORE MUTABLE STATE IN THIS OBJECT. The object provided must be serializable!.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalyzerConfig.SegmentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of audio block to process.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalyzerConfig.SegmentOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount that each audio block should overlap.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalyzerConfig.ResampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the default sample rate to re-encode all input audio as.
member.remarks:
ResampleRate must be 2Ã— the desired Nyquist.
Default value = 22050.
Once upon a time we used 17640.
Units=samples.
Users of this value should always fallback to a default appropriate for the analysis. Currently that default must be non-null, but we're considering allowing it to be null to support variable sample rate analysis.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.AnalyzerConfig.RequireDateInFilename
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a file must have a date in the file name.
member.remarks: If true, an unambiguous date-time must be provided in the source file's name. If true, an exception will be thrown if no such date is found. If false, and a valid date is still found in file name, it will still be parsed. Supports formats like: prefix_20140101T235959+1000.wav, where +1000 is in this case the time-zone offset for Brisbane. prefix_20140101T235959+Z.wav, where +Z is the zero time-zone offset. prefix_20140101-235959+1000.wav prefix_20140101-235959+Z.wav For more info on dates, see "dates.md" at https://github.com/QutEcoacoustics/audio-analysis/tree/master/docs.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.FileSegment
member.summary: Represents a segment of a target file. It can also store the parent file that a new segment has been derived from. A segment is just a stored start and end for a target file - it represents a future, or a request. Other functions can take the segment request, cut out the selected range, and return a new file segment. New file segments, or segments that represent a whole file, will not have the segment properties set because they do not represent a request anymore.

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.FileSegment.#ctor(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Use this constructor if you know all the information about a segment beforehand.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Use this constructor if you know all the information about a segment beforehand (except for the date it was created).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Allow specifying an absolutely aligned (to the nearest minute) file segment. Implies `FileDateBehavior.Required`. NOTE: Start offset will be set to start of file, and end offset set to the end of the file.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Allow specifying an absolutely aligned (to the nearest minute) file segment. Implies `FileDateBehavior.Required`. NOTE: Start offset will be set to start of file, and end offset set to the end of the file.

member.summary: Try and parse the file's absolute date

member.summary: Parse the file's absolute date and fail if unsuccessful

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.FileSegment.FileDateBehavior.None
member.summary: Do no try and parse the file's date at all.

member.remarks: These properties are the source for and are maintained as nullables for backwards compatibility. However as far as is concerned null is not a valid value.

member.summary: Gets or sets SegmentEndOffset - the value that represents what ending point of the target file should be used.
member.remarks: These properties are the source for and are maintained as nullables for backwards compatibility. However as far as is concerned null is not a valid value.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether gets ISegmentSet - whether or not either of the segment properties have been set.

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.IAnalyser2.ConvertEventsToSummaryIndices(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AnalysisBase.ResultBases.EventBase},System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Double)
member.summary: Allows Events to be rendered as Summary Indices.
member.remarks: This method used to be used on every segment but we are phasing out segment-level results. Thus it is recommended it only be used at the end of the analysis when the full result set (and when equals the full recording length) is available.
member.param: The unit time of the summary indices to produce.
The duration of audio for the period analyzed that produced events.
A threshold to filter out low-scoring events.
member.returns: A set of summary indices that describe the input events.

member.summary: Post-processing for an entire analysis.
member.param: The settings used for the analysis.
A reference to the original audio file that was analyzed.
The summary indices produced so far.
The raw result objects produced so far.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.EventBase
member.summary: The base class for all Event style results.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.EventBase.SegmentStartSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (in seconds) from start of the file/recording to start of the current audio segment.
member.remarks: will always be greater than or equal to .

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.EventBase.Score
member.summary: Gets or sets a score for the event.

remarks.para: The meaning, range, and behaviour of the value is purposely undefined. It varies with each algorithm used and we recommend that you only compare values as relative measures between events produced by the same algorithm.

If a particular recogniser wishes to define semantics for this value, it should: - Override this property and add relevant documentation. - Or add a new property (that possibly aliases this value) that defines and documents its semantics.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.EventBase.EventStartSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the Event's Start Seconds. IMPORTANT: This field is time offset relative to the recording. It automatically updates when set.
member.remarks: 2017-09: This field USED to be offset relative to the current segment. 2017-09: This field is NOW equivalent to .

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.EventBase.SetEventStartRelative(System.TimeSpan,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets both the Segment start and the Event start. is measured relative to the start of the recording. is measured relative to the start of the segment. This method sets both and which are both measured relative to the start of the recording.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase
member.summary: This is the base type for every type of result we produce. This includes: events, summary indices, and spectral indices. These classes will hold much redundant information - the flat format is useful for CSV output.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename of the audio file this result produced.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase.ResultStartSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the result start time in seconds. This is relative to the start of the recording. This basically allows every sort of result to be sorted/time indexed from the start of the file/recording.
member.remarks: I.e. the time since the start of the original audio recording. E.g. Given segment 78 of a 120min audio file, with a segment size of 60 seconds, this property would hold 78 minutes. And again: StartOffset is the time offset between the start of the recording and the start of the current result.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase.SegmentDurationSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of audio segment that produced this result. This is tracked because there is typically some error in cutting out segments of an audio file and it is useful to know how much audio was actually used to generate the result.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase.ResultMinute
member.summary: Gets the ResultMinute. This is the floored integer minute of .

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase.CompareTo(AnalysisBase.ResultBases.ResultBase)
member.summary: Defines an innate order of Analysis results based on the SegmentStartOffset.
member.param: The other AnalysisResult to compare to.
member.returns: A integer representing the relative order between the two instances.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.SaveBehavior

member.summary: Never save the associated resource. This is a synonym for Never and is provided for compatibility.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.SaveBehavior.Never
member.summary: Never save the associated resource.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.SaveBehavior.True
member.summary: Always save the associated resource. This is a synonym for Always and is provided for compatibility.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.SaveBehavior.Always
member.summary: Always save the associated resource.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.SaveBehavior.WhenEventsDetected
member.summary: Only save the associated resource when events have been found in the segment

member.summary: Gets an output image file - most likely a spectrogram Analysis implementations must not set this.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.SegmentSettingsBase.AnalysisIdealSegmentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the ideal duration of audio for the segment being analyzed. This number represents what was requested for cutting whereas the actual duration of audio provided by SegmentAudioFile may differ slightly due to inaccuracies in cutting audio.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.SegmentSettingsBase.SegmentStartOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the start offset of the current analysis segment. For a large file, analyzed in minute segments, this will store Minute offsets (e.g. min 1, min 2, min 3...).

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.SegmentSettings`1.Segment
member.summary: Gets the segment from which audio segments are extracted for analysis.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.SegmentSplitException
member.summary: Represents an error thrown when some aspect of a segment split is not allowed.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.Segment.InvalidSegmentException
member.summary: An exception thrown when an has invalid data set.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISegment`1
member.summary: Represents a range of audio from a source object. SEGMENTS ARE NOT HIERARCHICAL CONSTRUCTS.
member.typeparam: The type of source file used.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISegment`1.Source
member.summary:
Gets the source audio object.
It is expected that will be a path or FileInfo for local sources. For remote sources, could be an arbitrary object. The for each format handles these differences.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISegment`1.SourceMetadata
member.summary: Gets information about the source.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISegment`1.StartOffsetSeconds
member.summary: Gets the start of the segment, represented by seconds from the start of the audio object.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISegment`1.EndOffsetSeconds
member.summary: Gets the end of the segment, represented by seconds from the start of the audio object.

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISegment`1.SplitSegment(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Allows for the creation of a new segment, keeping the original source but changing the offsets.
member.param: The new start offset to use for this segment.
The new end offset to use for this segment.
member.returns: A segment from the same source, with new offsets.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISourceMetadata
member.summary: Information about a source audio object.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISourceMetadata.Duration
member.summary: Gets Duration - the length of the source audio object.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISourceMetadata.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets SampleRate - the number of samples per second in the source audio object. Store sample rate of original audio object. May need original SR during the analysis, esp if have upsampled from the original SR.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISourceMetadata.Identifier
member.summary: Gets Identifier - a string that uniquely identifies the source audio object.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.ISourceMetadata.RecordedDate
member.summary: Gets the date the source audio object started recording at.

member.name: M:AnalysisBase.Segment.SourceMetadata.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The duration of the source audio object.
The sample rate of the source audio object.
The Date the audio recording was recorded.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.SourceMetadata.Duration
member.summary: Gets Duration - the length of the source audio object.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.SourceMetadata.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets SampleRate - the number of samples per second in the source audio object. Store sample rate of original audio object. May need original SR during the analysis, esp if have upsampled from the original SR.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.SourceMetadata.Identifier
member.summary: Gets Identifier - a string that uniquely identifies the source audio object.

member.name: P:AnalysisBase.Segment.SourceMetadata.RecordedDate
member.summary: Gets the date the source audio object started recording at.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown or not set.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.InDevelopment
member.summary: Code exists and it may run without failure.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.Alpha
member.summary: The analysis works as determined by at least one unit test.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.Beta
member.summary: The analysis is covered by a suite of external tests as well as internal unit tests.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.Maintained
member.summary: Works, internal tests, external tests, wide spread utility.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.Unmaintained
member.summary: Not maintined, or updated. May work but most likely stale and out of date.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.Status.Retired
member.summary: Does not work, or you are advised not to use due to fundamental problems.

member.name: T:AnalysisBase.TimeAlignment
member.summary: Indicates the automatic alignment style used to produce segments that align to the nearest minute in absolute time.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.TimeAlignment.None
member.summary: No alignment is done

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.TimeAlignment.TrimBoth
member.summary: Alignment to the nearest minute is done. Both start and end fractional components are discarded.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.TimeAlignment.TrimStart
member.summary: Alignment to the nearest minute is done. The end fractional component is discarded but the start fractional component is kept.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.TimeAlignment.TrimEnd
member.summary: Alignment to the nearest minute is done. The start fractional component is discarded but the end fractional component is kept.

member.name: F:AnalysisBase.TimeAlignment.TrimNeither
member.summary: Alignment to the nearest minute is done. Neither start or end fractional components are discarded.
